headline: Shoyu Chicken
description: Shoyu chicken is Hawaii's take on teriyaki chicken made with skinless thighs marinated in a sweet, spicy soy sauce, then grilled and served with rice.

video.description: Similar to teriyaki chicken, this is a tasty grilled meal with rich flavors!
video.name: Shoyu Chicken

name: Shoyu Chicken

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk together soy sauce, brown sugar, water, onion, garlic, ginger, black pepper, oregano, red pepper flakes, cayenne pepper, and paprika in a large glass or ceramic bowl. Add chicken thighs and toss to coat evenly. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap; marinate chicken in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour.
Preheat an outdoor grill to medium heat. Lightly oil the grate.
Remove chicken thighs from marinade; discard remaining marinade.

Grill chicken thighs on the preheated grill until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, about 15 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).

review.reviewBody: Used the oven method -- 35 minutes at 375 degrees on a rack over a foil lined pan. Didn't vary the marinade ingredients. Marinated three hours in the fridge. Would do again.

I left out the oregano because it made zero sense to me. I also left out the red pepper flakes because i am pretty sure shoyu chicken should have a balanced flavor. "1 onion" is a super vague spec. What kind of onion? How big? I got onions almost 4" across and onions the size of garlic cloves. I cooked the thighs at 225f in my pellet grill until they reached 165f internal temperature. Everyone loved them.
I didn't add red pepper flakes or cayenne pepper

So delicious and different than any other marinated chicken than I’ve made before. I used smoked paprika instead of regular paprika. I also added garlic Chile paste in addition to garlic to add a kick. My wife loved it!!! I made grilled pineapple as the side. So good

Delicious and SO simple!! Some people only want it reviewed if you do it exactly as is and I guess if I was a professional reviewer that would be correct but taste is subjective somewhat so flexibility should be part of the charm of the recipe. I KNEW I wouldn’t want so much raw onion so I used half the amount. I could tell it was already quite spicy/peppery so I didn’t add the optional cayenne but did try the full amount paprika. I grilled boneless skinless chicken breasts because my health requires low fat. This will be on my alternating regular menu..

Been using your recipe for several years, but never grilled; either oven baked or simmered on stovetop in large Dutch oven. After trying, I adjusted to family's tastes: Added 20 oz. can pineapple chunks, drained & reserved 1/2 cup of juice. Replace water w/ this juice & 1/2 c. apple cider vinegar. (Recipe needs this tang!) No oregano. Adjust cayenne pepper amount to how HOT yours it! The sauce is good on rice also. Options: peanuts &/or a little peanut butter stirred into sauce after dish is cooked.
I have 2 of the pickiest kids around, rarely do I find something they will both eat. This was a winner and will make it again and again.

I have made this a dozen times and love it!! I found it's easier to combine all ingredients in blender then marinate that way the kids don't see the onions. Made for several people and they all loved.

Tastes like a restaurant dish, wonderful blend of flavors. I cooked the chicken in a pot with the sauce instead of marinating, it came out super juicy and tender. I fished the thighs out and let them cook enough to de-bone then put the coarsely chopped chunks back in the pot to warm. I served with pineapple rice. If you like spicy, dip more sauce out, if you don't like it hot, use a slotted spoon to just get chicken.
This was fantastic as is!!
Used legs instead of thighs, but unfortunately put on the grill when it was too hot. Even after scraping off the burned outside, chicken was still awesome, everyone loved it. Marinated overnight.

I was very skeptical about this recipe but decided to make it for my family. Needless to say it was very tasty and retained its moisture. Thanks for the recipe its now going to be a regular on our menu. P.S. don't be afraid of using more fresh ginger!

Irritating that someone would post a negative review based on the name of the recipe. This is now my go to marinade. This is so scrumptious i can’t even describe! If you don’t like the name, rate the recipe and if you must….complain about the name.
My family and I loved this recipe. It was simple yet delicious!
Hands down, one of the best chicken marinades I’ve ever had. This is now a staple for us. The only thing I did different was used low sodium soy. So delicious!
Delicious! I marinated the chicken for two hours, it could have marinated longer. Great flavor with a kick!
This is a very good sauce on chicken or beef, will use it a lot this summer. 4.5 stars
Easy to make- nice flavor- if you’re bored with plain old chicken- this will kick up your taste buds!
The only thing I'd recommending: to mix sugar with lukewarm water and then add the rest of the ingredients. Sadly I did not prepare enough chicken bc it was a blockbuster!!

I ran out of my usual “bottled” marinade so we whipped up a batch of this sauce to use as a marinade for grilled chicken... wow! I’ll NEVER use store bought bottled marinade ever again. Soooo flavorful!

This is a great base recipe and also made it with frozen chicken. I tweaked it by using chicken stock instead of water, and only had the powdered versions of garlic, onion and ginger on hand, used 2 teaspoons of each. 1/2 the black pepper. This sat in the crockpot for a good 5 hours on high. Served it with white rice. This recipe is money!

I don't care if the name for this is wrong. I took one bite and came on here to write a review. This is GOOD. I heated up the sauce in order to use it on the rice and served it with bok choy too. Definitely saving this recipe to use again. I don't have a grill so I baked it at 400 for 45 mins like someone else recommended. Taste like restaurant quality food. Ok back to eating
Delicious. Very tender and juicy with a little bite! Will make again and again
Excellent. Marinated chicken breasts for about 5 hours. Served with Chef John’s Savory Coconut Rice. Love it!

Really good
Would make it a bit spicier for us next go around
Took suggestion of using 1/2 pineapple juice & 1/2 broth instead of water
Marinade is great. I’d advise letting it marinade over night, then grilling over a low heat. Also try this with green onions instead.
Great recipe, yummy chicken thighs! I served it with braised carrots and bell peppers. Will make again!

I used boneless chicken thighs and halved the recipe. 

These grilled up really nicely and cook faster than bone-in thighs. 

There's a lot of sugar in this marinade so controlling the heat on the grill is very important to avoid scorching the chicken. I have used both "grill grates" heat deflectors and a combination of direct and indirect grilling with good results.
Made for dinenr

I usually LOVE everything i try on allrecipes.com but this one was not the best. I completely agree with other reviews, the oregano completely hijacked this entire meal. I would try this recipe again without oregano however it was incredibly salty too and I used la choy not kikkoman.. I added a whole can of dole pineapple pieces with the juice, used almost two cups of brown sugar and you would have never known. My wife said im not allowed to make this again. :(

Everyone loves this and how spicy it is. My brother in law was hungry and didn't like the look of it but have it a try. Loved it and took the recipe. I make with breasts and cut into chunks and serve over the rice with and extra sauce. So yummy

I prefer chicken breasts but my husband accidentally bought thighs. I was convinced that I probably wouldn't like the thighs no matter what recipes I used. This was so good that I am now going to cook with thighs. Never expected them to be so good!! I will definitely be making this recipe again. Thanks for sharing.

My husband and I loved this recipe. It is only the two of us, so I halved the recipe. I used legs instead of thighs, but it was fantastic. Next time, and there will most definitely be a next time, I will try thighs. I included the pepperflakes and cayenne. It was a tad spicy for me, but hubby loved it. Also we always remove the skin. The flavor was all over the chicken and it was moist and tender. Great recipe, thank you!
Really good chicken thighs. I followed the recipe and the cooking directions. The flavor and texture were amazing! I’m giving it a 5 rating. Will cook this again.

A fantastic recipe and I used another’s suggestion and boiled my marinade on the stove for ten minutes then diluted a Tbsp of cornstarch before adding it to the marinade, for brushing on the grilled chicken! Superb with a spicy bite to it!
Loved this recipe, super simple, and so tasty.

Soooo yummy! I used breasts and can only imagine how much more delicious thighs will be. I strained off the onion from the marinade and let them sauté a bit on the grill, then added the rest of the marinade and reduced. Used as a glaze for the rice and sautéed veggies and it was heaven! I used all optional ingredients. Sweet heat may accumulate for spice-shy folks. Delicious! Will be on regular rotation.
Family favorite
Our whole family really loved this recipe. I gave it 4 stars because it wasn't the best chicken I've ever had, but it was still very good. Easy to prep, and very easy to cook. I will make this again.

This is amazingly good! I used boneless chicken thighs and marinated them over night, i left out the cayenne pepper because the fresh ginger gave it enough spice for me. Threw them on the grill and served with white rice and a salad. My Son who say’s he “hates chicken” well this is his favorite dish.
Used boneless skinless chicken thighs, about 7-8 min per side, and boiled down the leftover marinade for a bit of extra sauce. Served over riced with a spoonful of sauce and a sprinkle of scallions.
Family thought it was too salty.
Very good recipe, family liked it a lot. It was slightly on the sweet side for my taste. Think I will reduce the brown sugar to 1/3 cup next time. Thanks for sharing this recipe.
I cut back on the sugar and the pepper by half. The heat was good, but there was little flavor. And it seemed to upset both of our stomachs a bit.

I followed someone's suggestion to put everything in a pot and simmer. I cannot tell you how absolutely DELICIOUS this was. I reduced the recipe to 4 servings, used 1 tsp ginger and 1/4 tsp of both cayenne pepper and paprika along with other ingredients - then added 1.5 tsp of cornstarch a few minutes before serving to thicken. I would give this recipe 10 stars if I could!
One if my favorite recipes. I use smoked paprika to give it a bit more smokiness.

Enjoyed this immensely, sweet, sticky and spicy what a wonderful trio. reduced the marinade and added a little corn starch to thicken, had it with potato wedges and a yummy vegetable meadly.This will be a repeat recipe at our house. Next time we'll have it with rice.

I don’t eat chicken but made this for my family and they all loved it! It’s now on our dinner rotation. I used ground ginger (1/8 tsp) and garlic powder and did not use paprika at all but may add next time. Served with brown rice and roasted broccoli.
Loved this recipe! Left in a Ziploc bag overnight, baked at 350 for 35-ish minutes, reserved marinade to boil and use as sauce. Skipped spices (except oregano) to make kid friendly (M).

This came out really great but I will admit that I made some adjustments...so take it with a grain of salt. FWIW, I used half the soy (I can't have the sodium), substituted 1 TSP of ground ginger for the ginger root and added 1/2 C of apple cider vinegar and 1/2 C of honey. Before anyone yells at me for adjusting the recipe, keep in mind I still rated it 5 stars as I think it would have been great even without my adjustments. Also, stay very close to the grill when cooking...these burn QUICK if you're not on top of them. I gave them grill marks then move to indirect for the remainder of the cooking time. Enjoy!
Wow! Fantastic flavors. Doing this one again.
I coked the over the stove and then made a sauce out of the remaining. Sooooo goood!

The is one of the BEST chicken dishes I’ve ever made. Everyone including the kids loved it. We reserved the marinade and reduced it to pour on leftovers. Used chicken breasts and it was perfect. Even added a little honey to the recipe. Would be yummy with some grilled pineapple.

I followed the recipe , but I. Put the ingredients in the blender to chop ... anywho the flavor was awesome , only let it marinate about an hour and half , next time I’ll do it over night .. very very good flavor I would suggest adding a little salt to the chicken before marinating ... still tasty .. cooked on a gas grill !!!
Soooo good! thumbs up from me, "1,000 thumbs up" from my ultra-very-insanely picky 5yo!
Delicious marinade. Used it on salmon and steak as well.

There was four of us eating this and 2 of us thought there was too much black pepper. Other then that we all really enjoyed this. We had broccoli as a side and the sauce on the broccoli is really good.
This was awesome! Made it on an indoor grill due to the weather. So delicious!!

This was so tasty! Left the sauce as is, but made a few changes:
Used breasts (we had them on hand)
Cooked covered in the oven in a roaster on a raised rack
Thickened with a bit of corn starch and cooked the marinade while the chicken was in the oven to make a sauce. 

Served with rice and mixed veg. Chicken was juice, and the sauce was amazing! This was a hit in my house and will be made again!
I used a pan, I ruined a pan, I can’t cook chicken. All in all was a great experience
This is a good weeknight recipe. I’d recommend marinating overnight if you can.
I am a kid who does not like spicy food. This is a bit spicy but a great marinade for chicken. I think you should try it.
A favorite. We've made this for friends and family - always a hit
My wife and kids loved this. I only had 3/4th a cup of soy sauce so I added about 1/8th a cup of Worcestershire.

This is a family favorite in our house! I use boneless, skinless thighs and marinate for the day until ready to cook. The chicken always comes out tender and flavorful with just the right amount of crispy, carmelized goodness around the edges. Great with yellow rice or jasmine/lime rice and steamed broccoli.
Marinated in a ziplock bag for an hour. Then put chicken and marinade in a baking pan at 400 until done.
My picky, diverse family LOVES this recipe!! Instead of grilling I bake it with all of the marinade and serve it over rice. A HUGE hit and they are all excited when we have this for dinner!
Although it looked mouthwatering from the pics, it didn't quite taste the way I imagined. It also required a lot of ingredients which I had to go out and buy.

Great grill recipe using chicken wings and overnight marinade. Using a Weber kettle, place wings over drip pan opposite medium fire of lump charcoal. Set top vent to 50% and let run 45 minutes to 1 hour. Wings will be done perfect and no charring.
absolutely YUMMY!!!! i didn't thicken the marinade though! thank you for sharing this recipe ;o)
My family loved this! Made exactly like recipe call for.

This recipe as made on the bbq is great. I wouldn't hesitate to make it again. However, the way to make it on the stovetop, as suggested by another reviewer, didn't do it for me. I tried and the texture of the chicken wasn't nearly as good, nor was the seasoning (too sweet). So this recipe still gets 5 stars because when made as per directions, it turns out fantastic.
Show me, I’ll Shoyu. I love this recipe. I cook this for my kids and the knuckleheads at my fire station. Everyone loves it. I don’t change a thing. It’s perfect

Very tasty recipe and a different flavor than just teriyaki. I made a major change which I think made it better. I did the wet marinade as directed. But then I took the dry ingredients and made a rub out f it. So once it was done marinading, I dried the chicken, and then rubbed them down with the spices. I thought it came out pretty good! If you go this method I would definitely cut back on the brown sugar though! Something to try next time.

There are two things to keep in mind when reading my review.

1) I'm a foodie. I can decypher taste, smell, texture, etc.
=but=
2) It takes a lot out of me to want to cook. I'd rather my meals prepared for me by a chef, or alternative.

With that out of the way; THIS DISH IS SO EASY TO MAKE AND IS SOOO GOOD, OMG! It instantly became a fan favorite and I've made it twice already.

I baked it in the oven, separated the chicken skin/fat, and then broiled it to crisp, Pro-tip; service with coconut rice and buttered carrots.

BOOM! First review on here ;)

We enjoyed this a lot! I've made it a few times now and it's been a hit every time. Plus, I usually really dislike leftover chicken, but this one works great for lunches the next day. My only tweak was to use Coconut Aminos instead of soy, due to an allergy. Coconut Aminos taste just like soy but with less sodium. I also baked the chicken in the marinade and then finished them on the grill. By baking the marinade with the chicken, it was safe to use as a sauce. I separated the onion s and solid bits from the juice, added corn starch and honey to what was left and had a great "teryaki" type sauce for spooning over the finished product. Delicious!
OMG ! Just Made This & The Recipe Is Wonderful . It’s A Lil Sweet With That Nice KICK To It . A Lil Too Much Of A Kick , Next Time I’m Going To Use 1/2 The Spice . Overall AMAZING Dish !!
Very tasty. Easy prep. Just baked in 350 degree oven about one hour. Will make again.
it's quite nice a bit of kick to it and the kids loved it
I add both coriander and cardamon along with the giner to give a both middle eastern and asian flair. My fiance' just enjoy the flavor.
this chicken is extremely good. no deviations from the recipe. thank you so much. this chicken is a hit at every BBQ we have. been making it for over a year now and still requested.
Awesome and easy to make. I cooked it in a cast iron skillet. Just as good.
I'll add more ginger next time and soak it for more than 15 mins. But, all in all, a good one.
Good flavor, just not my families favorite.
Definitely a keeper!
I made this recipe per instructions, divided it, and did half chicken and half steak kabobs on the grill. So good and so easy!

Followed the recipe as directed. I placed the boneless chicken thighs in a ziplock bag over night. It was delicious, the whole family enjoyed sweet and salty and hint of spice flavors. Will definitely make again
Oh my, this is my first review after making hundreds of recipes here. This is by far the best chicken marinade I've ever tasted. Even my kids loved it!
It was great
This is one of my family favorite chicken recipes. Quick and easy.
Grilling boneless chicken thighs for 30 min? When internal temp reaches 163 degrees, pull them off. That usually happens about 7 min per side on my Weber grill.
My husband and I really enjoyed this. It was the perfect balance between sweet and spicy.

This is delicious!! I used the suggestion of substituting pineapple juice for the water and I used green onions for the onion. I also used Italian seasoning instead of just oregano, since that was all I had. cooked it on the grill, very yummy!! I omitted the pepper flakes, but did add 1/4 tsp of cayenne pepper, which I think I will omit next time. Also I prefer it a bit sweeter, so I may add more brown sugar next time or possibly honey. Either way I will definitely make this again!!

This was delicious. I upped the red pepper flakes and cayenne by half again and it wasn't too spicy for us. Marinated about 6 hours and cooked on the grill. I boiled the marinade and thickened it up with cornstarch. Served with Jasmine rice with the sauce drizzled over it.

This recipe is SOOOOO easy to prepare but the end result is fabulous. I also marinated some sliced zucchini with the chicken and grilled it along with the meat and it was DELICIOUS!!!! I would definitely give this one 5 stars!!!
awesome! We love chicken and this marinade is simple, fast and good.

Had chix thighs and was jonesing for this! We just got back from Hawaii... Had to improvise w what we had in house! Used raw sugar and molasses to be brown sugar, sushi ginger. Whirled all in cuisenart. Marinated for 20 mins, baked on 400 then finished off in broiler, basting with marinade chicken was baked in to make really brown and caralmalizedGood stuff!
Fantastic!

Great marinade made the chicken tender and juicy. I grilled on the BBQ and the tender meat started to fall apart (perhaps it was bc I used a boneless skinless thighs) for next time I will use bone-in skin-in thighs and a grill grate. Added a little bit of corn starch slurry to the marinade and reduced it. Tasted excellent. Thank you for the recipe!
